Batch Processes

Lesson
objectives

¢ Describe the role batch processes play in
Guidewire applications

¢ Implement custom batch processes

* Schedule batch processes

¢ Describe some best practices that can be
implemented when updating a database ina
batch process

Batch process overview

i What is a batch process?

Bl

Exchange rate Exchange Rate
System

© _ +

¢« Abatch process is a background process that performs tasks independent of a
user

* Typically, a batch process runs on a periodic schedule
* Two type of batch process
« Predefined

* Custom

i Types of batch processes Gi

* Configured in the base application * Created by an integration developer

* Examples: ¢ Allows for periodic scheduling of work
+ ContactManager: Duplicate Contacts Finder beyond what the base application provides
* ClaimCenter: Claim exception + Is fully configurable
+ PolicyCenter: Policy renewal start * Can include triggers to integration points

* BillingCenter: Account inactivity

* Developers can schedule or manually run
each process but cannot directly configure
what each does

+ Some processes can be indirectly configured
because they trigger configurable elements

i Batch process execution options

* Common ways to execute a batch processes

+ Periodically based on a schedule (the most
common use)

+ Immediately from the Internal Tools UI
+ From an API call such as a web service or
command line
* Every execution option is not necessarily
configured for every process
+ Duplicate Contacts Finder batch process:
* Can be run from the UI and scheduled

+ Not configured to be executed from an API but
every batch process that is UI runnable is inherently

API runnable

class FlagOverdueLegalReportsBatch extends BatchProcessBase {

* Application calls the method to determine whether to start a batch process

¢ Used to determine if conditions are met to begin processing

« Return true: doWork method will be called

¢ Return false: only a history event will be written

¢ Default: true

i requestTermination method

¢ The application may want to
terminate a batch process,
such as when...

* The process is run from the Ul
and the user clicks Stop 2s of

* The process is run from the API 27
and the stop process command
is received

* The application is shutting down

¢ Handled by setting
TerminateRequested
property in code and used to
exit any loops

boolean {

override function requestTermination()
super. requestTermination()
return true by

}

override function checkInitialConditions() : boolean {...}

override function doWork() {
TimeUnit. SECONDS. sleep (15)
if (TerminateRequested) {

throw new TerminatedException("Process terminated")

ports = 0

var messageQuery = Query.make (Message)
messageQuery. compare (Message#DestinationID, Relop.Equals, 15)
var results0bj = messageQuery.select()
for (currentMessage in results0bj) {
if (TerminateRequested) {
throw new TerminatedException ("Process terminated")
}

i Other methods and properties on BatchProcessBase

Gi

* getDescription
+ Retrieves the description of the current batch type

* incrementOperationsCompleted

+ Increments an internal counter for how many
operations are complete

+ Returns the current number of operations that are
complete

* incrementOperationsFailed

* Increments an internal counter for how many
operations failed

* Call this method to track the progress of the batch
process

« Exclusive

+ Determines whether another instance of this batch
process can start while this process is running

+ The base class implementation always returns true

+ Set this property to false if you want to allow multiple
instances of this batch process to run in parallel.

* OperationsExpected

+ Set this once after determining number of items to
be processed

+ Used to provide feedback in the UI for Ul Runnable
Processes

i Configure ProcessesPlugin class

package trn.ta.batch

uses gw.plugin.processing. IProcessesPlugin
uses gw.processes.BatchProcess
uses trn.ta.batch. legalreport. FlagOverdueLegalReportsBatch

class ProcessesPlugin implements IProcessesPlugin {

override function createBatchProcess(type : BatchProcessType, arguments : Object[])
switch(type) {
case BatchProcessType. 1C_FLAGOVERDUELEGALREPORTS:
return new FlagOverdueLegalReportsBatch ()
default:
return null

: BatchProcess {

¢ Open scheduler-config.xml file found under configuration.config.scheduler

¢ dayofmonth - ? is used only for dayofmonth and dayofweek attribute and means
without regard to this value

¢ dayofweek -* means all values

* hours - 3 means 3am using 24-hour clock

i Updating the database in a batch process

No CurrentBundle for a batch process

Use Transaction. runWithNewBundle(/ bundle ->{} , “user”) OF
Transaction.newBundle ()

If you expect to update large numbers of rows:
Large number of rows is a relative term
Consider using paging with regular commits
Keep bundles size as small as possible
Be careful about how you use accessors

Use Query best practices
* Do filtering at the database rather than in memory — let the DB do what it’s good at

+ See Gosu Queries and Bundles and Database Transaction lessons for more information

i Updating the database in a batch process Gi

r

¢ Problematic approach:

* Two main problems:

*« Memory

+ Processing a possibly large
queryResult set

¢ Bundle performance il

uses gw.api.database. Query
uses gw.transaction.Transaction

Transaction. runWithNewBundle(\bundle -> {
var queryObj = Query.make (ABContact)
var queryResult = queryObj.select()
for (€ in queryResult) {

var entityToModify = bundle.add(e)
}
2}

+ Every new accessor drags an entity into the bundle

+ And using accessors from those entities drag in more entities

+ Bundles can grow very large

i Abetter approach: Paging plus regular commits Gi

uses com.google.common.collect.Iterables
uses gw.api.database.Query
uses gw.transaction.Transaction

var queryObj = Query.make(ABContact)
var queryResult = queryObj.select()
queryResult.setPageSize (10000)

for (entities in Iterables.partition(queryResult, 250)) {
Transaction. runWithNewBundle(\bundle -> {
for (€ in entities) {
var entityToModify = bundle.add(e)

i Paging with modifications

Question

_- — Whatare the three ways a batch process can be run? Which of the three

Pa is the most common?
7

SS ee eee ae eee

Gi

Answer Gi

_- — Whatare the three ways a batch process can be run? Which of the three

Pa is the most common?
7

Three way to run a batch process are:
* Scheduled
¢ Run from the UI

« Run from the web service API

See eee ee eae

Scheduled is the most common way to run a batch process.

Question

,- — When you add a new batch process typecode to BatchProcess Type,
¢ why must you add one or more categories to the typecode?

¢
¢

SS ee eee ae eee

Gi

Answer Gi

,- — When you add a new batch process typecode to BatchProcess Type,
Pa why must you add one or more categories to the typecode?
¢

The categories of a BatchProcessType typecode determines how the batch process
can be run (from the UI, scheduled, from the API, and/or in maintenance level).

See eee ee eae

Question

_- — When creating a custom batch process, do you need to implement the

Pa ProcessesPlugin or just modify it?
¢

SS ee eee ae eee

Gi

Answer Gi

_- — When creating a custom batch process, do you need to implement the
Pa ProcessesPlugin or just modify it?
¢

For PolicyCenter and ClaimCenter, the IProcessesPlugin file already exists in the base
application and you only need to modify the ProcessesPlugin class which implements
the IProcessesPlugin interface.

For BillingCenter and ContactManager, you need to create an IProcessesPlugin
registry file that implements the IProcessesPlugin interface in a new class.

See eee ee eae

Question

_- — Foracustom batch process, what method or methods require

Pa implementation?
¢

SS ee eee ae eee

Answer

_- — Foracustom batch process, what method or methods require
Pa implementation?
¢

Only the doWork method is required.

See eee ee eae

Question

,- — How does a batch process commit changes to the database?

¢
¢
¢

SS ee eee ae eee

Answer

_- — How does a batch process commit changes to the database?
¢

¢
¢

The code must create a new bundle using runWithNewBundle and add the entities to
be changed and committed to that bundle.

See eee ee eae

i Updating the database in a batch process

No CurrentBundle for a batch process

Use Transaction. runWithNewBundle(/ bundle ->{} , “user”) OF
Transaction.newBundle ()

If you expect to update large numbers of rows:
Large number of rows is a relative term
Consider using paging with regular commits
Keep bundles size as small as possible
Be careful about how you use accessors

Use Query best practices
* Do filtering at the database rather than in memory — let the DB do what it’s good at

+ See Gosu Queries and Bundles and Database Transaction lessons for more information

Question

,- — When you add a new batch process typecode to BatchProcess Type,
¢ why must you add one or more categories to the typecode?

¢
¢

SS ee eee ae eee

Gi

Answer Gi

,- — When you add a new batch process typecode to BatchProcess Type,
Pa why must you add one or more categories to the typecode?
¢

The categories of a BatchProcessType typecode determines how the batch process
can be run (from the UI, scheduled, from the API, and/or in maintenance level).

See eee ee eae

Question

_- — When creating a custom batch process, do you need to implement the

Pa ProcessesPlugin or just modify it?
¢

SS ee eee ae eee

Gi

Answer Gi

_- — When creating a custom batch process, do you need to implement the
Pa ProcessesPlugin or just modify it?
¢

For PolicyCenter and ClaimCenter, the IProcessesPlugin file already exists in the base
application and you only need to modify the ProcessesPlugin class which implements
the IProcessesPlugin interface.

For BillingCenter and ContactManager, you need to create an IProcessesPlugin
registry file that implements the IProcessesPlugin interface in a new class.

See eee ee eae

Pa implementation?
¢

SS ee eee ae eee

Answer

_- — Foracustom batch process, what method or methods require
Pa implementation?
¢

Only the doWork method is required.

¢

Answer

_- — How does a batch process commit changes to the database?
¢

¢
¢

The code must create a new bundle using runWithNewBundle and add the entities to
be changed and committed to that bundle.
